| take 1

parameters.name: GBperday
parameters.description: Shows Average per Day over selected Duration (GB)
parameters.query:
Usage
| where TimeGenerated > startofday({TimeRange:start}) and TimeGenerated < startofday({TimeRange:end})
// Only look at chargeable Tables
| where IsBillable == True
| summarize
TotalBytes =round(sum(Quantity))
by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
| summarize GBperday = round(avg(TotalBytes)/1000,2)

parameters.name: selectDepthLevel
parameters.label: Select the detail level
parameters.description: Basic data (default) will load much faster than Advanced insight into the data

parameters.name: Help
parameters.label: 📖 Help
parameters.description: This will show some help information to help you understand the page you are on

parameters.name: GBtotal
parameters.query:
Usage
| where StartTime {TimeRange:value}
| where IsBillable == True
| parse ResourceUri with *'/subscriptions/' SubscriptionId '/resourcegroups/'*
| where SubscriptionId == '{Subscription:id}'
| summarize Gbytes = sum(Quantity)/1000  by SubscriptionId
| project TotalGBytes = round(Gbytes,2)

content.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces' 
| where id has "{Workspace}"
| extend state = trim(' ', tostring(properties.provisioningState))
		,sku   = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.name))
        ,skuUpdate = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.lastSkuUpdate))
		,retentionDays = trim(' ', tostring(properties.retentionInDays))
		,dailyquotaGB  = trim(' ', tostring(properties.workspaceCapping.dailyQuotaGb))
| extend dailyquotaGB = iif(dailyquotaGB !=-1.0, dailyquotaGB,"Not set")
| extend skuUpdate    = iif(strlen(skuUpdate) > 0, skuUpdate,"Unknown")
| extend sentinel     = iif(toint(retentionDays) < 90,"If you have Sentinel, you can change your retention to 90days (free)?","")
| project ['Log Analytics Workspace Name']=id, ['Resource Group']=resourceGroup, location, ['Data Retention(days)']=retentionDays, ['Last known SKU update']=skuUpdate, ['Daily Data Cap']=dailyquotaGB, ['Licence']=sku,  ['Commitment Tier']=properties.sku.capacityReservationLevel, ['Notes'] = sentinel

content.json:
## Workspace Usage Report 
### Change Log
Use this report to analyze the the sizes of the different tables and Latency in your workspace and agents.  This report checks the overall workspace health.

|Version|Description|
|---|---|
|v1.1|Added Events Per Second (EPS) to Workspace Info Tab.| 
|v1.2|Added EPS with a breakdown for Device Vendor in CommonSecurityLog
|v1.3|Added EPS Tab and Min, Max values
|v1.4 | Added Checks Tab for Daily, Weekly and Monthly suggested checking routines.  Also Defender for Cloud info in Costs Tab.
|v1.4.2 | Added Groups to all Tabs. Added Price info and Help button.
|v1.4.3 | Added to [COST] tab and report of "GBytes used per Computer" 
|v1.4.4 | Quick fix to get the TableName duplicate removed.  Added value to Y axis of [Cost] trend graph, Remove content (EPS) that is planned for the Sentinel Health workbook.  
|v1.4.5 | Added extra Cost info, improve Weekly reports and other grids , testing release ONLY
|v1.4.6 | Moved Price to Costs Analysis Tab (all pricing is now in the same place). Added some table data, description and links to Latency grid.  Filter on Queries in Weekly report and Workspace audit filters |
|v1.4.7 | Add Pie chart of % billable vs. free to Cost Analysis.  Add count of Rules, Rule Templates and Hunting Queries (just unique ones).  Extra Defender for Cloud  report for "minimal","common" and "all". Additional troubleshooting displays, when Help toggle is on. % used for Tables. User filter for LAqueries.|
|v1.4.8 | [Cost Analysis] is now a Tab with Sub Menus to aid load times and readability.  New features:Syslog Cost Analysis, CEF Cost Analysis, in the [OverView] sub menu, there are now reports on capacity / price per Subscription, Resource Group and Tags.  The Sentinel tab, has reports for Usage vs. Capacity Reservation and recommendtions for the settings you are on, for Log Analytics and Sentinel. |
|v1.4.9 | Add extra filtering within 'Advanced Workspace Details', so you can select other Workspaces to audit, and provide a link to the related Workbook (if its installed).  Add a filter for a basic level of data in the complex reports (default) or selected Advanced for the original longer running query.  Added Automation rules to Alert Rules in Weekly reporting.  Removed Tags section for now in Overview report.  Added Sentinel cost estimate for retention.|
|v1.5.0 | Added an ADX Tab (more to add here, maybe just a placeholder for now). Added some reports on Template rules vs Active Rule by *Type* (so you can see what is deployed vs. available by each rule type/category) in the Weekly reports.  Fix for Chart bug that can cause a “out of memory” error. Wording swapped to "Commitment Tiers" rather than Capacity Reservation. | 
|v1.5.1 | Performance tweaks. GB to GB correction.  Drill down on Computer costs. Add link to ADX insights |
|v1.6 | Change to new product names + fix subscription issue | 
|v1.6.1 | Improve Weekly view and Rules. Add Funcytion Alias view, add DCR view  | 

 insights |To do Next: n/a

## Help File

More details in the Wiki: https://github.com/clivewatson/KQLpublic/wiki/Workbook-Usage

## Usage
	- Please select your **Subscription** and **Workspace**
	- Time Range: is the time you wish to query back to. i.e 7days from now, into the past.
	- Help is available in various parts of this Workbook.
	- Select the Detail Level - is a toggle to reduce the page load time of certain queries.
## Categories
	- Azure Monitor Logs (Workspace)
	- Sentinel
	- Defender for Cloud
## Solutions
|Solution|Description|
|---|---|
| Workspace Infomation | info about the workspace, usage and statistics|
|Latency | Which Tables or machines have latency issues, average, minimun and maximum values|
|Costs Analysis| Looking again at the tables in the [Workspace Info] tab, but also you can select a Price of your choosing (£,$).  Sub menus have been added to aid drill-down to specific products or data|
|Sentinel | specifc data about Sentinel|
| Regular Checks | Daily, Weekly and Monthly suggested checks you can look at.|

## Data Sources
	- Azure Resource Graph (ARG) and Various tables within Azure Monitor Logs (Workspace).

## Anomoly Detection
Some reports now show anomoly detection, this explains the Score: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/anomaly-detection#time-series-anomaly-detection

Anomaly scores above 1.5 or below -1.5 indicate a mild anomaly rise or decline respectively. Anomaly scores above 3.0 or below -3.0 indicate a strong anomaly.

content.json:
### Columns explained
- Table Name:The Log Analytics workspace Table
- Table Size: The sum of data stored in the Table.   
- Table Entries: The count of each row in the Table. 
- Size per Entry: Average capacity size of each row of data.
- IsBillable: Shows if the Table is Billable or Free  (True/False).
- Last Record Received: What was the time that the last record of data was received?

content.json:
If an Sentinel Workspace has been enabled for less than 30days is likely to be in the Free Trial period.  The report above shows when a Workspace was first created and when Sentinel was associated with it.
Also on this Page
- Top 10 Operations actions from the AzureActicity log for Sentinel.  
- Select a Table (only Sentinel ones are listed) to see more details.

parameters.name: SelectPct
parameters.label: Anomaly spikes %
parameters.query:
range value from 10 to 100 step 10
| project value, display=value, selected=value

content.query:
//source: https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/azure-sentinel/ingestion-cost-spike-detection-playbook/ba-p/2591301
let UpperAnomalyThreshold = +3;
let ReportingQty = 0;
let PercentIncrease = {SelectPct};
let UpperThreshold = UpperAnomalyThreshold; //+3 is the suggested number and it indicates a strong anomaly though you can modify it : Outlier - Wikipedia
Usage
| where IsBillable == "true" //we are only interested in tables getting notified when a spike is detected in a billable table 
| where Quantity > ReportingQty //Allows you to report only on variations that are above a certain threshold that you deem significant enough to warrant an alert
| make-series Qty=sum(Quantity) on TimeGenerated from {TimeRange:start} to now() step 1d by DataType //creates a time series to look at the ingestion pattern over the period defined in the LookBack variable
| extend (anomalies, score, baseline) = series_decompose_anomalies(Qty, 1.5, 7, 'linefit', 1, 'ctukey', 0.01) //takes the time series of ingested data across the days specified in the ‘LookBack’ variable and extract anomalous points with scores based on predicted values using the linear regression concept. See https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/series-decompose-anomaliesfunction for a detailed explanation of each argument. For an explanation of 'ctukey' read: Outlier - Wikipedia.
| where anomalies[-1] == 1 or anomalies[-1] == -1 //the output of series_decompose_anomalies function is three things: A ternary (as opposed to binary) series containing (+1, -1, 0) marking up/down/no anomaly respectively, the Anomaly score and the predicted value or baseline. 
| extend Score = score[-1] //this part picks up the anomaly state from the most recent run. -1 indicates a position in the array. 
| where Score >= UpperAnomalyThreshold  //compare with strong anomaly indicator values extracted from the time series data
| extend PercentageQtyIncrease = ((round(todouble(Qty[-1]),0)-round(todouble(baseline[-1]),1))/round(todouble(Qty[-1]),0) * 100) //calculates percentage increase to present data in percent terms for easier appreciation of the anomaly
| project DataType,ExpectedQty=round(todouble(baseline[-1]),0), ActualQty=round(todouble(Qty[-1]),0),round(PercentageQtyIncrease,0)  
| order by  round(todouble(PercentageQtyIncrease),0) desc 
| where PercentageQtyIncrease >= PercentIncrease //only alert if the percentage increase exceeds the threshold beyond which you specified that you wish to be notified
content.title: Ingestion Spikes - anomaly detection > {SelectPct}% increase

content.query:

content.json: ### End to End Latency Report by Table

In this report we measure the latency of a specific Table by comparing the result of the ingestion_time() function to the TimeGenerated property.
Source: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/data-ingestion-time

content.query:
//
// Add enrichment information about selected Tables
//
let enrich = datatable (TableName:string,Information:string,link:string)
    [
    "Usage","This is common Usage data in all Workspaces","https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/manage-cost-storage",
    "Operation","This is common Operations data in all Workspaces","",
    "OfficeActivity","This is a PUSH data source, typically <30mins (max ~1day)","https://docs.microsoft.com/office/office-365-management-api/troubleshooting-the-office-365-management-activity-api#what-is-the-maximum-time-i-will-have-to-wait-before-a-notification-is-sent-about-a-given-office-365-event",
    "Perf","Operational Data source, this can have limited value to Sentinel","https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-data-sources",
    "Event","Windows Server Event Logs","https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-data-sources",
    "Syslog", "Syslog messages using Common Event Format (CEF) streamed from variety of security solutions.Learn more","https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-data-sources",
    "SecurityAlert","Security Alerts from various sources","https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-data-sources",
    "Alert","Alerts from Azure Monitor sources","",
    "AWSCloudTrail","Sentinel: AWS Cloud trail connector","",
    "Anomalies","Sentinel: This table contains anomalies generated by the active Anomaly analytics rules in Sentinel.","",
    "AADNonInteractiveUserSignInLogs","Non-interactive Azure Active Directory sign-in logs from user","",
      "SecurityEvent","Data from Defender for Cloud  or Sentinel","https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-data-sources",
    "CommonSecurityLog","CEF data for Sentinel, from multiple vendors","https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-data-sources",
    "SecurityIncident","Incident events from Sentinel, also see SecurityAlert","",
    "Heartbeat", "MMA info from Log Analytics agents","",
    "LAQueryLogs","Auditing of the workspace has been set","https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/log-query/query-audit",
    "VMConnection","Azure Monitor for VMs or Service Map","https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/vmconnection",
    "KubeServices","AKS data sources","",
    "Update","Patching info","",    
    "ThreatIntelligenceIndicator","Sentinel TI data","", 
    "AuditLogs","Azure AAD audit information","", 
    "SigninLogs","Azure AAD Signin information","", 
    "AzureActivity","Azure Activity Logs","",
    "HuntingBookmark","Sentinel - Hunting book mark data","",  
    "UserPeerAnalytics","Sentinel - UEBA","",  
    "UserAccessAnalytics","Sentinel - UEBA","",  
    "IdentityInfo","Sentinel - UEBA","",  
    "BehaviorAnalytics","Sentinel - UEBA","", 
    "DeviceEvents","Sentinel: This table is part of Microsoft Defender for Endpoints with Sentinel. This table contains Multiple event types, including events triggered by security controls such as Windows Defender Antivirus and exploit protection.","",
    "DeviceFileEvents","Sentinel: This table is part of Microsoft Defender for Endpoints with Sentinel. This table contains File creation, modification, and other file system events.","",  
    "DeviceImageLoadEvents","Sentinel: This table is part of Microsoft Defender for Endpoints with Sentinel. This table contains DLL loading events","",  
    "DeviceInfo","Sentinel: This table is part of Microsoft Defender for Endpoints with Sentinel. This table contains Machine information, including OS information.","",  
    "DeviceLogonEvents","Sentinel: This table is part of Microsoft Defender for Endpoints with Sentinel. This table contains Sign-ins and other authentication events","",  
    "DeviceNetworkEvents","Sentinel: This table is part of Microsoft Defender for Endpoints with Sentinel. This table contains Network connection and related events.","",  
    "DeviceNetworkInfo","Sentinel: This table is part of Microsoft Defender for Endpoints with Sentinel. This table contains Network properties of machines, including adapters, IP and MAC addresses, as well as connected networks and domains.","", 
    "DeviceProcessEvents","Sentinel: This table is part of Microsoft Defender for Endpoints with Sentinel. This table contains Process creation and related events.","", 
    "DeviceRegistryEvents","Sentinel: This table is part of Microsoft Defender for Endpoints with Sentinel. This table contains Creation and modification of registry entries.","",             
    "DnsInventory","DNS Analytics (Preview)","",     
    "W3CIISLog","IIS log data from Azure Monitor Logs",""
    ]
; 
// Gather and calculate Latency information
union withsource = TableName1 *
| summarize 
      ['average E2E IngestionLatency'] = round(avg(todouble(datetime_diff("Second",ingestion_time(),TimeGenerated)) ),2)
    , ['minimun E2E IngestionLatency'] = round(min(todouble(datetime_diff("Second",ingestion_time(),TimeGenerated)) ),2) 
    , ['maximum E2E IngestionLatency'] = round(max(todouble(datetime_diff("Second",ingestion_time(),TimeGenerated)) ),2)
  by TableName = TableName1
| sort by ['average E2E IngestionLatency'] desc
// join to enrichment and remove unwanted columns 
| join kind= fullouter (enrich) on TableName
| where isnotempty(TableName)
| project-away TableName1

[

    { "value":"1h", "label":"1 hour without heartbeat", "selected":true },

    { "value":"1d", "label":"1 day without heartbeat", "selected":false },

content.title: HeartBeat

content.query:
Heartbeat  
| where Computer startswith "{ComputerName}"
| extend E2EIngestionLatency = todouble(datetime_diff("Second",ingestion_time(),TimeGenerated)) 
| extend AgentLatency        = todouble(datetime_diff("Second",_TimeReceived,TimeGenerated)) 
| summarize avg(E2EIngestionLatency),avg(AgentLatency) by bin(TimeGenerated,1h) 
| project TimeGenerated, avgE2Elatency = avg_E2EIngestionLatency, avgAgentLatency = avg_AgentLatency
content.title: Latency

content.query:
Heartbeat
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| summarize LastHeartbeat = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer
| extend State = iff(LastHeartbeat < ago({UnhealthyCriteria}), 'Unhealthy', 'Healthy')
| extend TimeFromNow = now() - LastHeartbeat
| extend ["TimeAgo"] = strcat(case(TimeFromNow < 2m, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1s), ' seconds'), TimeFromNow < 2h, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1m), ' minutes'), TimeFromNow < 2d, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1h), ' hours'), strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1d), ' days')), ' ago')
| join (
Heartbeat
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| extend Packed = pack_all()
) on Computer
| where TimeGenerated == LastHeartbeat
| join (
Heartbeat
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| make-series InternalTrend=iff(count() > 0, 1, 0) default = 0 on TimeGenerated from {TimeRange:start} to {TimeRange:end} step {UnhealthyCriteria} by Computer
| extend Trend=array_slice(InternalTrend, array_length(InternalTrend) - 30, array_length(InternalTrend)-1)
| extend (s_min, s_minId, s_max, s_maxId, s_avg, s_var, s_stdev) = series_stats(Trend)
| project Computer, Trend, s_avg
) on Computer
| order by State, s_avg asc, TimeAgo
| project ["_ComputerName_"] = Computer, ["Computer"]=Computer, State, ["Environment"] = iff(ComputerEnvironment == "Azure", ComputerEnvironment, Category), ["OS"]=iff(isempty(OSName), OSType, OSName), ["Azure Resource"]=ResourceId, ["Time"]=strcat('🕒 ', TimeAgo), ["Heartbeat Trend"]=Trend, ["Details"]=Packed

content.json: Measures the HeartBeat of a specific Computer, and then shows latency by comparing the result of the ingestion_time() function to the TimeGenerated property

### Workspace Pricing

Price Parameter: Please provide an estimated cost so that we can get a value in the "Estimated Table Price" column, in the [Workspace Info] tab.   
i.e If your Log Analytics PAYG is £2.00 per GB enter 2.00.  You can enter an interger (without a currency symbol), in format 1.0, 2.0, 3.1 etc...  
If you want to see the combined Log Analytics + Sentinel estimated cost please use both PAYG prices i.e. 2.00 + 2.00 = 4.00.  Please see the licence pages for both products.

Base value on 7th July 2020, using an example of Sentinel ($2.46 US Central PAYG) + Log Analytics ($2.76 US Central PAYG) 


Note: No capacity reservation is taken into account.


### Anomoly Detection
Some reports now show anomoly detection, this explains the Score:
https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/anomaly-detection#time-series-anomaly-detection

Anomaly scores above 1.5 or below -1.5 indicate a mild anomaly rise or decline respectively. Anomaly scores above 3.0 or below -3.0 indicate a strong anomaly.

### Microsoft Defender for Cloud (formally Azure Security Center) 

Defender for Cloud allows for 500MB/day (0.5GBytes) of *free* data to be sent by each Computer. Please see the licencing link at the bottom of this text box.
You have two variables
1. The total allowed: < number of computers> * 0.5GB  (this is a pooled metric). 	
	e.g 4 computers * 0.5GB = 2.0GB, the maximum value which is allowed to be sent for free.  Any data over this number will have the standard (Sentinel + Log Analytics) charge applied.     
2. The actual data sent by each computer
	e.g 4 * computers * 0.1GB = 0.4GB, which is allowed for free.

To fully calculate the Microsoft Sentinel average GBytes per day, if D4C data is present, we need to  take #1 from the total or #2.  This is shown as the "Revised GB Number". 

### Note: Licencing is subject to change, you must fully investigate and understand from the current documentation the implications.
https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/security-center/  correct as of 17th September 2020. 
RESOURCE TYPE	FREE TIER	STANDARD TIER (a.k.a "Azure Defender ON")
Virtual Machine	Free	$0.02/Server/Hour
Included data - 500 MB/day

content.json:
### Commitment Tier Insight
This report, shows the Average GB/day (based on the TimeRange parameter), which is rounded up to the nearest whole number, this is the number the Azure Pricing Calculator requires. https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/calculator/ for Sentinel.
- The Pay as You Go (PAYG_estimate) is the GB/day multiplied by the [Sentinel Price] parameter, default is 2.0 (the price in $ for EAST US).  This is location and currency neutral, so adjust to your own preferred value.  This is the Daily estimate of the price.
- The Pay as You Go (PAYG_estimate_mthly) is the Monthly (31day) estimate of the price.
- Commitment Tier_Estimate_Monthly is the (PAYG_estimate_mthly) minus any discount for the commitment Tier that is *currently* set.
- Data ingested into Sentinel exceeding the selected daily commitment tier is charged at the effective tier prices. source: https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/azure-sentinel/

content.query:
project actual_ = '{GBperday}' , roundUp_ = round(toreal('{GBperday}'),0)
| extend lookBack = 31
| extend roundUp_ = iif(isnan(roundUp_),toreal(0),toreal(roundUp_))
| extend PAYG_estimate = roundUp_ * {SentinelPrice}
| extend discountRate = iif(isempty('{discountRate}'),"0",'{discountRate}')    
| extend PAYG_estimate_mthly = (PAYG_estimate * lookBack)
| extend CT_estimate_mthly = PAYG_estimate_mthly * tolong(discountRate) / 100
| summarize by ['avg GB/day']=roundUp_, PAYG_estimate, PAYG_estimate_mthly, CT_estimate_mthly
content.title: Commitment Tier. Price per GB:{SentinelPrice},  Discount %: {discountRate}

content.json:
### Commitment Tier for your Average GB/day value?  
This report helps you decide:
- A green circle in a Status column 🟢 indicates your are on the Optimal setting, based on your average data ingestion (GB/day) and Pay As You Go/commitment tier settings.
- A recommend value of "0" / zero, means that you are on a setting (SKU) such as Free, PerGB etc.. rather than a commitment tier setting.
- If the 'recommend' Sentinel or Workspace setting doesn't match the 'current' setting you will get a Red Cross in the Status columns ❌.
- Please read https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/azure-sentinel/ and https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/monitor/ before deciding.

content.query:
project actual_ = '{GBperday}' , roundUp_ = round(toreal('{GBperday}'),0)
| extend lookBack = 31
| extend i = roundUp_ //* 100
| extend i = iif(isnan(i),toreal(0),toreal(i))
// Sentinel commitment tier logic
| extend recommendedSentinelCT = case(
    i  <= 50,"0",
    i between (51 .. 180),"100",
    i between (181 .. 286),"200",
    i between (287 .. 390),"300",
    i between (391 .. 476),"400",
    i between (477 .. 975),"500",
    i between (976 .. 1897),"1000",
    i between (1898 .. 4729),"2000",
    i >= 4730 ,"5000",
    //else
    strcat("unknown Sentinel CT: ", i)
)
// Azure Log Analytics (LAW) commitment tier logic
| extend recommendedWorkspaceCT = case(
    i <= 85,"0",
    i between (86 .. 187),"100",
    i between (188 .. 293),"200",
    i between (294 .. 391),"300",
    i between (392 .. 491),"400",
    i between (492 .. 982),"500",
    i between (983 .. 1952),"1000",
    i between (1953 .. 4849),"2000",
    i >= 4850 ,"5000",
    //else
    strcat("unknown LAW CT: ", i)
)
| extend avgDataPerDay = i
| extend currentSentinelCT = iif(isempty('{SentinelCap}'),"0",'{SentinelCap}')
| extend currentWorkspaceCT = iif(isempty('{lawCap}'),"0",'{lawCap}')
| extend sentinelOptimal = iif(recommendedSentinelCT == currentSentinelCT,1,0)
| extend lawOptimal = iif(recommendedWorkspaceCT == currentWorkspaceCT,1,0)

content.json:
## Defender for Cloud : Usage Reports
- - -

The following two charts help you understand Microsoft Defender for Cloud / **SecuityEvent** data if its present.
- Top 10 computers, sending that SecuityEvent logs information & the capacity SecuityEvent 
- The final chart shows the potential allowance (each Defender for Cloud licence allows for 500MB/day). 
	
	- Defender for Cloud / a.k.a "Azure Defender ON" was formally "ASC standard". 
	- You can see what was Used vs. Allowed  (where allowed = 500MB * < count of servers>)

content.query:
// https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/manage-cost-storage#log-analytics-and-security-center
let ascTables = dynamic(['WindowsEvent', 'SecurityAlert', 'SecurityBaseline', 'SecurityBaselineSummary', 'SecurityDetection', 'SecurityEvent','WindowsFirewall', 'MaliciousIPCommunication', 'LinuxAuditLog', 'SysmonEvent', 'ProtectionStatus']);
union withsource = tt *
| where TimeGenerated > ago(30d)
| where _IsBillable == True
// Calculate the daily GB size per billable Table and unique Server count 
| summarize allGBytes =sum(_BilledSize)/(1024*1024*1024), ascGBytes=sumif(_BilledSize, Type in (ascTables))/(1024*1024*1024), ascComputerCount = dcountif(Computer,tt in (ascTables)) by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
// Calculate daily GB average, and average ASC server count.  Each Server is allowed max 0.5GB each
| summarize avg(allGBytes), avg(ascGBytes),ascComputers=round(avg(ascComputerCount),0),ascMaxGB = avg(ascComputerCount) * 0.5
// If ASC sends less than the allowed max, revise the GB averge per day, else use the max allowed (all servers * 0.5)
| extend revisedNumber = iif(avg_ascGBytes <= ascMaxGB, allMinusASCused = (avg_allGBytes - avg_ascGBytes),allMinusASCused = (avg_allGBytes - ascMaxGB) )
| extend withinPool = iif(avg_ascGBytes >= ascMaxGB,"Yes","No")
| extend overBy = iif(round(avg_ascGBytes,2) - round(ascMaxGB,2) < 0 , toreal(0),  round(avg_ascGBytes,2) - round(ascMaxGB,2)  )
| project ['Raw Average GB']   = avg_allGBytes,
          ['Defender has used, GB'] = strcat(round(avg_ascGBytes,1)," GB of " ,round(ascMaxGB,1), " GB across ", ascComputers , " Computers"), 
          ['Revised GB Number']= round(revisedNumber,2),
          ['Help'] ="Please toggle [Show Help] to Yes,  for more information", 
          ['Sent more than allocation?'] = withinPool,
          ['Overage in GB'] =  overBy

content.json:
The following three charts help you understand SecuityEvent data if its present.
- SecurityEvents are captured in Groups: All, Common, Minimal and None
- Using https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/series-decompose-anomaliesfunction we will look at this data
- There are displays for Activity and EventIds that are captured in _Minimal_ and _Common_. Note _Minimal_ is a subset of _Common_
- _"All"_ is a special case, as there isn't a list of those, I have listed any EventIds found, but only those not within _Common_
- Using anomoliesfunction, we look at the expected count, actual count, give that a score (the higer varienences are marked in Red), a baseline and and Trend for the TimeRange

items.name: text -ASC help for minimal common and all

parameters.name: AnomalyTuning
parameters.description: Anomaly scores above 1.5 or below -1.5 indicate a mild anomaly rise or decline respectively. Anomaly scores above 3.0 or below -3.0 indicate a strong anomaly. 2.0 added for a Medium range.

content.title: "minimal" data set - {TimeRange:label}. anomaly-detection: {AnomalyTuning:label}

content.query:
//
// source: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/security-center/security-center-enable-data-collection#data-collection-tier
//
let common = dynamic([1,299,300,324,340,403,404,410,411,412,413,431,500,501,1100,1102,1107,1108,4608,4610,4611,4614,4622,
4624,4625,4634,4647,4648,4649,4657,4661,4662,4663,4665,4666,4667,4688,4670,4672,4673,4674,4675,4689,4697,
4700,4702,4704,4705,4716,4717,4718,4719,4720,4722,4723,4724,4725,4726,4727,4728,4729,4733,4732,4735,4737,
4738,4739,4740,4742,4744,4745,4746,4750,4751,4752,4754,4755,4756,4757,4760,4761,4762,4764,4767,4768,4771,
4774,4778,4779,4781,4793,4797,4798,4799,4800,4801,4802,4803,4825,4826,4870,4886,4887,4888,4893,4898,4902,
4904,4905,4907,4931,4932,4933,4946,4948,4956,4985,5024,5033,5059,5136,5137,5140,5145,5632,6144,6145,6272,
6273,6278,6416,6423,6424,8001,8002,8003,8004,8005,8006,8007,8222,26401,30004]);
SecurityEvent
| where EventID in (common)
| summarize Count = count(), BilledSize= sum(_BilledSize) by EventID, Activity
| order by EventID asc 
| join 
( 
    SecurityEvent
    | make-series Trend = count() on TimeGenerated from startofday({TimeRange:start}) to startofday({TimeRange:end}) step {TimeRange:grain} by EventID
    | extend (anomalies, score, baseline) = series_decompose_anomalies(Trend, 1.5, 7, 'linefit', 1, 'ctukey', 0.01)
    | extend Score = score[-1]
    | extend expectedEventCounts=baseline[-1], actualEventCount=Trend[-1], Score = score[-1], Trend
    | project-away score
) on EventID
| where Score > {AnomalyTuning} or Score < toreal(strcat("-",{AnomalyTuning}))
| project-away EventID1
| project Activity, expectedEventCounts, actualEventCount, Score, Trend, baseline, anomalies, Count, BilledSize

content.query:
//
// Predict data volume for the next month
//
let startDate = {TimeRange:start}; // go back in time nn days
let endDate   = now();     // what is the date now
let projectTo = now()+90d; // project forward nn days
let projectForward = 90;   // must be same as projectTo value
//union withsource = TableName1 *
//| where TimeGenerated between (startDate .. endDate )
Usage
| where IsBillable == True
| make-series GBytesToday=sum(Quantity)/1000 default=0 on TimeGenerated from {TimeRange:start} to projectTo step 1d 
| extend GBytesForecast = series_decompose_forecast(GBytesToday, projectForward)
| extend dayBacks = (toint('{TimeRange:seconds}') / toint(86400))-1
| extend  todayVolume = array_slice(GBytesToday, dayBacks, dayBacks)[0], 
          predictionVolume = array_slice(GBytesForecast, array_length( GBytesForecast)-1, array_length( GBytesForecast)-1)[0]
| project priceToday =  todayVolume * {Price},
          pricePrediction = predictionVolume * {Price}, todayVolume, predictionVolume
content.title: Actual Data Volume and Price vs. 90 day Prediction.

// https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/anomaly-detection#time-series-anomaly-detection

content.json: This Tab is used to recommend tasks to perform on a Daily, Weekly or Monthly basis.  These tasks have been taken from work in the community.

Daily Operational Tasks	
1. Data Connectors 
Look through active Data Connector and verify the Last Log Received date/time is current to ensure data is flowing.
2. Investigate Incidents 
Investigate Incidents to determine if any Analytics Alerts rules were triggered. Set status and begin investigation. Resolve or reassign.	
3. Hunting Queries and Bookmarks (links provided)	
Explore the built-in query results. Update existing hunting queries and bookmarks. Manually generate new or update old Incidents if applicable. Apply automation (Playbooks) where required.	
4. Analytics Rules (links provided)	
Identify any newly released (or newly available due to recently connected Data Connectors) Analytics Rules and enable those that are applicable. Apply automation (Playbooks) where essential.

| order by  ['Last Record Received'] desc

content.json:
Weekly Operational Tasks	
1. Log Analytics Agent
Verify the servers (or workstations) are showing a connected status in the workspace. Troubleshoot and remediate failed connections.
2. Workbooks Updates 
Verify in the Sentinel Dashboard blade if an installed Workbook has an update that needs installed.
3. GitHub Alert Rules, Workbooks, Hunting queries, Content Hub and Playbooks	
Visit and review the Sentinel GitHub repository and explore if there are new or updated Detection Rules, Workbooks, Hunting queries, Content Hub or Playbooks of value that can be added to the environment.

| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| summarize LastHeartbeat = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer
| extend State = iff(LastHeartbeat < ago({UnhealthyCriteria}), 'Unhealthy', 'Healthy')
| extend TimeFromNow = now() - LastHeartbeat
| extend ["TimeAgo"] = strcat(case(TimeFromNow < 2m, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1m), ' seconds'), TimeFromNow < 2h, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1m), ' minutes'), TimeFromNow < 2d, strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1h), ' hours'), strcat(toint(TimeFromNow / 1d), ' days')), ' ago')
| join (
Heartbeat
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| extend Packed = pack_all()
) on Computer
| where TimeGenerated == LastHeartbeat
| join (
Heartbeat
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| make-series InternalTrend=iff(count() > 0, 1, 0) default = 0 on TimeGenerated from {TimeRange:start} to {TimeRange:end} step {UnhealthyCriteria} by Computer
| extend Trend=array_slice(InternalTrend, array_length(InternalTrend) - 30, array_length(InternalTrend)-1)
| extend (s_min, s_minId, s_max, s_maxId, s_avg, s_var, s_stdev) = series_stats(Trend)
| project Computer, Trend, s_avg
) on Computer
| order by State, s_avg asc, TimeAgo
| project ["_ComputerName_"] = Computer, ["Computer"]=strcat('🖥️ ', Computer), State, ["Environment"] = iff(ComputerEnvironment == "Azure", ComputerEnvironment, Category), ["OS"]=iff(isempty(OSName), OSType, OSName), ["Azure Resource"]=ResourceId, ["Time"]=strcat('🕒 ', TimeAgo), ["Heartbeat Trend"]=Trend, ["Details"]=Packed

tooltipFormat.tooltip: Click to see details of the last event sent by this computer.
Each bar represents the bucket of time based on the Unhealthy Criteria. Showing last 30 buckets max.

content.query:
resources
| where "{Subscription:Id}" has subscriptionId or "{Subscription}" == ""
//| where "{resourceGroup:label}" contains resourceGroup or "{resourceGroup}" == ""
| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'MicrosoftMonitoringAgent' or name has 'OmsAgentForLinux' 
| extend Computer = extract('virtualMachines/(.*)/extensions',1,id) 
| summarize count()
content.title: Machines with MMA

content.query:
resources 
| where "{Subscription:Id}" has subscriptionId or "{Subscription}" == ""
| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent' or name has 'AzureMonitorLinuxAgent' 
| extend AzureVM = extract('virtualMachines/(.*)/extensions',1,id), ArcVM = extract('machines/(.*)/extensions',1,id) 
| summarize count() by AzureVM, ArcVM, subscriptionId, resourceGroup 
| project AzureVM, ArcVM, resourceGroup
| summarize count()
content.title: Machines with AMA

content.query:
resources
| where "{Subscription:Id}" has subscriptionId or "{Subscription}" == ""
| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or  type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'MicrosoftMonitoringAgent' or name has 'OmsAgentForLinux' or name has 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent' or name has 'AzureMonitorLinuxAgent'
| extend AzureVM = extract('virtualMachines/(.*)/extensions',1,id), ArcVM = extract('machines/(.*)/extensions',1,id)
| summarize count() by AzureVM=tolower(AzureVM), ArcVM=tolower(ArcVM), subscriptionId, resourceGroup 
| extend hasBoth = iff(count_ > 1, 'Yes', 'No') | where count_ > 1 
| join (resources | where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'MicrosoftMonitoringAgent' or name has 'OmsAgentForLinux' 
| extend AzureVM = extract('virtualMachines/(.*)/extensions',1,id)) on AzureVM  
| summarize count()
content.title: Machines with Both Agents

content.query:
resources
| where "{Subscription:Id}" has subscriptionId or "{Subscription}" == ""
| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or  type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'MicrosoftMonitoringAgent' or name has 'OmsAgentForLinux' or name has 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent' or name has 'AzureMonitorLinuxAgent'
| extend AzureVM = extract('virtualMachines/(.*)/extensions',1,id), ArcVM = extract('machines/(.*)/extensions',1,id)
| summarize count() by AzureVM=tolower(AzureVM), ArcVM=tolower(ArcVM), subscriptionId, resourceGroup, AgentType=name
| extend hasBoth = iff(count_ > 1, 'Yes', 'No') //| where count_ > 1

content.query:
// Use Usage as a common Table that always exists - its data isnt required. 
union isfuzzy=true 
(
 Usage
 | project a = '{countRuleTemplates:value}'
 | limit 1
 | extend a = split(a,","), name_= "Available Rule Templates"
 | mv-expand a
 | summarize count(), rt=count() by name_
),
(
 Usage
 | project c = '{countActiveRules:value}', utw = '{activeRulesUpdatedDate:value}'
 | limit 1
 | extend c = split(c,","), name_= "Active Rules", utw = split(utw,",")
 | mv-expand c, utw
 | summarize count(), updateThisWeek = countif(todatetime(utw) between (ago(7d) .. now())), ar=count() by name_
),
(
 Usage
 | project d = '{huntingQueries:value}'
 | limit 1
 | extend d = split(trim(@"[^\w]+",d),","), name_= "Hunting Queries"
 | mv-expand d to typeof(string)
 | summarize count() by name_
)
| order by name_ asc

content.query:

Usage
| project  a = split('{RuleByDate}',",")
| limit 1
| mv-expand todynamic(a)
| project b= split(trim(@"[^\w]+",tostring(a)),"T").[0]
| summarize count() by todatetime(b)
| order by b asc
| top 10 by b

content.json:
Monthly Operational Tasks	
1. Log Analytics Agent
Ensure the agent is up-to-date and auto-upgrades are working. For those not auto upgraded, perform a manual update.
2. Log Analytics Workspace	
Review that your Log Analytics Workspace retention policy still aligns with your current configuration. Run the Data Usage queries to help maintain costs and retention determinations.
3. Ad-hoc: 	Access review
Has your SOC team changed? Review RBAC and IAM to verify those that need access have proper access – and those accounts no longer needing access are removed.
4. Ad-hoc: 	Review workspace locations
Are your workspaces in the right Regions, or are there any new ones?

content.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces' 
//| where id has "{Workspace}"
| extend state = trim(' ', tostring(properties.provisioningState))
		,sku   = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.name))
        ,skuUpdate = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.lastSkuUpdate))
		,retentionDays = trim(' ', tostring(properties.retentionInDays))
		,dailyquotaGB  = trim(' ', tostring(properties.workspaceCapping.dailyQuotaGb))
| extend dailyquotaGB = iif(dailyquotaGB !=-1.0, dailyquotaGB,"Not set")
| extend skuUpdate    = iif(strlen(skuUpdate) > 0, skuUpdate,"Unknown")
| extend sentinel     = iif(toint(retentionDays) < 90,"If you have Sentinel, you can change your retention to 90days (free)?","")
| project ['Workspace Name']=id, ['Resource Group']=resourceGroup, location, ['Data Retention(days)']=retentionDays, ['Last known SKU update']=skuUpdate, ['Daily Data Cap']=dailyquotaGB, ['Licence']=sku, ['Notes'] = sentinel, tags, properties
| order by ['Workspace Name'] asc
